title: Tree falls onto wiring at Newtown Station after truck crash
text:
A fallen tree has caused disruption at a Sydney train station this afternoon, with commuters facing delays as a result of the incident.

Some passengers had to be evacuated from a train close to the incident.

A truck reportedly crashed into a tree at Newtown, in the city’s inner west, this afternoon, causing it to fall onto overhead wiring at the station.

Sydney Trains said crews were working to remove the tree and told passengers to allow plenty of extra travel time.

“Regular services are still running and diversions are in place, however journey times may be longer as trains are required to slow down as they travel through the affected area,” it said in a tweet.

Footage showed rail crews helping passengers climb out of the train that became stuck after the incident.

“Tree collapsed on overhead wiring and onto tracks. original plan was to go backwards to Burwood but now evacuating just before Newtown,” one person said on Twitter.

One social media user claimed they were stuck inside a train for one and a half hours before being evacuated.

“ONE AND A HALF HOURS NOW! STUCK INSIDE A TRAIN, because Sydney trains has NO OHS officers that can report and maintain POTENTIAL HAZARDS. So many people need the bathroom,” one Twitter user said.

they managed to open up one of the gates in the fence and safely let us through #sydneytrains pic.twitter.com/Tq4qWixTTF — caleb (@calebb_t) October 29, 2019
description: A fallen tree has caused disruption at a Sydney train station this afternoon, with commuters facing delays as a result of the incident.
